meanings.definition: The act of cutting away the outer skin or peel of a fruit or vegetable.
meanings.sent1: She carefully used a paring knife to remove the apple peel.
meanings.sent2: The chef's precise paring of the potato skin impressed the judges.
meanings.sent3: The paring of the orange peel flew into the air and landed on the cat's head.
meanings.sent4: Her paring of the carrot peel revealed the vibrant orange underneath.
meanings.sent5: The paring of the cucumber peel curled like a ribbon on the cutting board.

meanings.definition: A thin strip or slice of something, especially food.
meanings.sent1: He added a paring of cheese to his sandwich for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The delicate paring of chocolate on top of the cake made it look elegant.
meanings.sent3: The paring of ham on his plate seemed to form a smiley face.
meanings.sent4: Her paring of the bread crust was so thin, it was almost transparent.
meanings.sent5: The paring of the lemon zest added a burst of citrus to the dish.
